{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3589390,"name":"Dave Morrison","username":"davemorrison","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/8dc957/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-11T22:40:33.105Z","cooked":"

Curious as to people’s practice here, do you do something special to protect the test port on wagos? Feel free to comment with what or other comments.

  • Wagos have a test port?
  • No, they are protected enough with the highly recessed port and/or orientation away from threat
  • Yes for some, where there a potential risk
  • Yes, protect for all
0 voters

No, honestly speaking i can understand why you would but theyve made troubleshooting electrical faults way easier for us so its been better to have them open. For the record, none of the faults weve had were due to the test ports being open
